alert.note: Alert for Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 11:58PM MDT until July 28 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Logan, Morgan and Washington. * WHEN...Until 200 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1158 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Pawnee Creek, Twentytwo Slough, South Platte River, Surveyor Creek, Baymer Creek and Sand Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Merino, Prewitt Reservoir, Atwood, Willard, Messex and Fremont Butte.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
